intro: Xyochlaena monachne, commonly known as the sacred orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers with a unique coloration pattern. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and requires specific soil conditions to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is often protected in conservation programs. Its botanical significance lies in its role in traditional medicine and its ecological importance in its native ecosystem.
